newsitem.title: UK: Eva Air begins pig vaccine airlift ex-UK.
newsitem.headline: Eva Air begins pig vaccine airlift ex-UK.

text.p: Eva Air has begun airlifting vaccine from the UK to Taiwan to help try and save the island's pig industry from the current epidemic of foot-and-mouth disease.
An airline cargo official told Reuters: "The first shipments were flown out this week and are expected to continue until at least the second week in April."

Nearly 400,000 pigs, including healthy ones, have died or been killed in a campaign to prevent the highly contagious virus from spreading. Taiwan officials say eventually 15 percent of the island's 11 million pigs could be slaughtered.
The Taiwan government is planning to import eight million doses of the vaccine to deal with the outbreak.
The vaccines are being carried by Eva Air on its three times a week flights from the UK and they are being exported by the Rhone-Merieux group from facilties in Surrey, the cargo official added.
He said other airlines offering cargo capacity to Taiwan from the UK are also believed to be involved in the airlift but declined to identify them.
